about.title: About ABGC
about.text1: The Adriatic Blue Growth Cluster (ABGC) enhances the capacity and competitiveness of companies and professionals operating in the blue economy sectors through mutual learning and collaboration.
about.text2: Building on the foundation of an already active cluster in Montenegro—established under the Smart Adria initiative—ABGC is evolving into a dynamic space where businesses, training institutions, and stakeholders across the value chain can connect, exchange experiences, and adopt shared learning practices.
about.text3: By fostering cooperation across borders and sectors, ABGC serves as a catalyst for innovation, skills development, and sustainable blue growth in the South Adriatic region.
about.pageDescription1: The Adriatic Blue Growth Cluster (ABGC) is a cross-border initiative that brings together businesses, institutions, and communities across the Adriatic region to promote sustainable development in the blue economy.
about.pageDescription2: Headquartered in Kotor, Montenegro, ABGC serves as a collaborative platform for advancing innovation, cooperation, and investment in key blue sectors—including fisheries, aquaculture, marine technologies, maritime transport, shipbuilding, and coastal tourism.
about.whatWeDoItem1: Networking and collaboration among enterprises, research institutions, and public authorities
about.whatWeDoItem2: Promotion of blue technologies and their adoption in the region
about.whatWeDoItem3: Participation in national and EU-funded projects
about.whatWeDoItem4: Consulting and training for businesses and stakeholders
about.whatWeDoItem5: Advocacy and policy engagement in the blue economy
about.ourStructureText: ABGC is organized into two regional sections:
about.ourStructureItem1: Central and South Adriatic Section — Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, and Montenegro
about.ourStructureItem2: South Adriatic Section — Albania, Italy, and Montenegro
about.whoCanJoinItem1: Businesses and cooperatives in blue economy sectors
about.whoCanJoinItem4: Individuals and professionals in marine/coastal development
about.whyJoinItem5: Help shape sustainable growth in the Adriatic

accordion.clusterText1: The Adriatic Blue Growth Cluster unites organizations from across the South and Central Adriatic, fostering collaboration, innovation, and sustainable development in the blue economy.
accordion.clusterText2: South Adriatic Cluster Supported by the Interreg South Adriatic SKILLS project, this cluster brings together dynamic members from Molise and Puglia (Italy), Albania, and Montenegro, focusing on skill development, innovation, and cross-border cooperation.
accordion.clusterText3: South and Central Adriatic Cluster Backed by Interreg Croatia – Bosnia and Herzegovina – Montenegro, this network connects organizations from Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Montenegro, promoting shared initiatives in research, aquaculture, marine conservation, and blue entrepreneurship.
accordion.clusterText4: Together, these clusters form a growing cross-border ecosystem dedicated to advancing the blue economy through partnership, knowledge exchange, and strategic alignment.
accordion.policyText1: The Adriatic Blue Growth Cluster (ABGC) actively supports evidence-based policymaking to strengthen the blue economy across the South Adriatic. By connecting decision-makers with industry insights, research findings, and stakeholder feedback, ABGC contributes to the development of forward-looking policies that address real needs—from workforce skills and innovation to environmental sustainability and digital transformation.
accordion.policyText2: Through its involvement in EU-funded projects and regional cooperation frameworks, the cluster helps align local and national strategies with EU priorities, ensuring that policy development is inclusive, data-driven, and impact-oriented.
accordion.partnershipText1: The Adriatic Blue Growth Cluster (ABGC) is a hub for building meaningful partnerships across borders and sectors. Whether you're a business, research institution, training provider, or public authority, ABGC offers opportunities to collaborate on innovative projects, pilot new technologies, co-develop training programs, and shape policies that drive sustainable growth in the blue economy.
accordion.partnershipText2: Through EU-funded initiatives and regional cooperation platforms, partners can access expertise, expand their networks, and unlock joint investment opportunities—turning ideas into impactful solutions for the South Adriatic and beyond.

contact.euDisclaimer: This website was created with the financial support of the European Union within the framework of the Interreg IPA South Adriatic programme, through the SKILLS project - High-Level and Market-Respondent Competences for a Blue and Digitalized "Smart and Skilled South Adriatic" (grant agreement SA-0200142-SA SKILLS). The content of this website is the sole responsibility of the University of Montenegro - Institute of Marine Biology and in no way can be considered to reflect the views of the European Union.

terms.title: Terms of Use and Privacy Policy
terms.subtitle: Welcome to https://southadriaticskills.org/me (hereinafter: "Site"). By using this Site, you accept these Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. If you do not agree with any part of these terms, please do not use the Site.

section1.title: 1. General Provisions
section1.text1: These Terms of Use define the rules for using the content and services available through the Site. The content on the Site is subject to copyright and other intellectual property rights.
section1.text2: The Site's content may be used for personal, non-commercial purposes, with explicit citation of the source. Any reproduction, distribution, or use for commercial purposes without permission is prohibited.

section2.title: 2. Collection of Personal Data
section2.text: When you use the Site, we may collect certain information about you, including:
section2.item3: user data that you voluntarily enter through forms
section2.item4: information about your device and how you use the Site

section3.title: 3. Purpose of Data Collection
section3.text: Data is collected for the following purposes:
section3.item2: sending informational newsletters if you have subscribed
section3.item3: improving functionality and user experience on the Site
section3.item4: analysis of visits and statistics (via cookies)

section4.title: 4. Cookies
section4.text: The Site uses cookies and similar technologies for:
section4.text2: You can control cookie settings through your browser settings or through the option displayed on your first visit to the Site.

section5.title: 5. Use of Data
section5.item2: sending notifications related to the Site
section5.text2: Data is not sold, rented, or shared with third parties without your consent, except when necessary to fulfill legal obligations.

section6.title: 6. Data Security
section6.text1: We take reasonable technical and organizational measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, disclosure, or misuse.
section6.text2: However, no security system is absolutely secure and we cannot guarantee complete data security.

section7.title: 7. Links to Other Sites
section7.text: The Site may contain links to other sites that are not under our control. We are not responsible for the content or privacy policies of those sites.

section8.title: 8. Changes to Terms and Privacy Policy
section8.text1: We reserve the right to modify these Terms and Privacy Policy at any time. All changes will be published on the Site with an updated date.
section8.text2: We recommend that you periodically review these terms to stay informed about any changes.

section9.title: 9. Contact
section9.text: If you have questions regarding these Terms and Privacy Policy, you can contact us at:
